channel.title: Building Kickesecure for Mac Silicon bootable USB?
channel.description:
Hi, don't know if this has been posted, Is it possible to build Kicksecure on the ARM64 Debian (like in whonix dev) as a bootable USB?
Thanks for all of your work, one of the best OS's out there!

item.title: Building Kickesecure for Mac Silicon bootable USB?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Thank you!

moosetits:

Is it possible to build Kicksecure on the ARM64 Debian (like in whonix dev)
as a bootable USB?

Maybe. At time of writing, it is Undocumented, Untested or Unsupported Features, because there is no maintainer for ARM64.

Option A) Build an ISO source code.

If you mean build from source code: Kicksecure ™ VM Build Documentation + you could try this build option:

--arch arm64

Option B) (Install Debian on USB +) distro-morphing. → Install Kicksecure inside Debian

Read full topic
item.source: Building Kickesecure for Mac Silicon bootable USB?
